page.title: 17Life Styles in Warbleton
page.content: With no schools and little employment in the area nearly all families below retirement age depend daily on motorised transport. Children are largely dependent on parents for transport. Visits by tradespeople are important for the housebound. Newspapers and mail are delivered daily, bread twice weekly and the milkman calls on alternate days. The mobile library from Lewes visits Rushlake Green weekly. Most families visit larger towns for shopping preferring freshness, variety and cheaper prices which village shops cannot offer. For Post Office services many prefer to avoid the inevitable queues in the larger town offices. Life in this area in the past has been extensively studied by the Warbleton & Distric History Group who have produced several publications.
